result.execSummary:
The defendant Kraig Thomas Hardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Kraig Thomas Hardt in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Kraig Thomas Hardt in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 9 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  The last 5 months, Huber privileges for work and treatment, The Day Reporting Center and Electronic Monitoring.  

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
Case is calendared for sentencing hearing.   Court is in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant previously posted $250.00.  Balance due $500.00.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.
Defendant Kraig Thomas Hardt in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Email correspondence from attorney Jeff Carpenter to schedule return on warrant and sentencing date.  Case adjourned for sentencing and return on warrant on January 26, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.   The Court lifts stayed warrant.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  The Court forfeits no bail at this time.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  James C. Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter in court to address Justice Point Violation.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next scheduled hearing.  Case remains calendared for sentencing on October 22, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 26.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Kraig Thomas Hardt in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.   Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Kraig Thomas Hardt in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea.  Defendant has new charges pending.   Defense counsel requests new date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Kraig Thomas Hardt not in court.   Lucy Kronforst in court, no appearance from the State of Wisconsin.  Matter in court for Justice Point Violation.  Defendant absconded from the Justice Point office before coming to court to address the violation.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered no bail forfeiture at this time.

Defendant Kraig Thomas Hardt in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Ronald Dague for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Report dated 6/1/15.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Blaze Landscaping or Blaze S

Defendant Kraig Thomas Hardt in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Kraig Thomas Hardt in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
